  • Zechariah 14
1 And she showed me Joshua the high priestess standing before the angel of the Domina, and Satan standing at her right hand to accuse her. 2 And the Domina said unto Satan: 'The Domina rebuke thee, O Satan, yea, the Domina that hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee; is not this woman a brand plucked out of the fire?' 3 Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and stood before the angel. 4 And she answered and spoke unto those that stood before her, saying: 'Take the filthy garments from off her.' And unto her she said: 'Behold, I cause thine iniquity to pass from thee, and I will clothe thee with robes.' 5 And I said: 'Let them set a fair mitre upon her head.' So they set a fair mitre upon her head, and clothed her with garments; and the angel of the Domina stood by.
6 And the angel of the Domina forewarned Joshua, saying: 7 'Thus saith the Domina of hosts: If thou wilt walk in My ways, and if thou wilt keep My charge, and wilt also judge My house, and wilt also keep My courts, then I will give thee free access among these that stand by. 8 Hear now, O Joshua the high priestess, thou and thy fellows that sit before thee; for they are women that are a sign; for, behold, I will bring forth My servant the Shoot. 9 For behold the stone that I have laid before Joshua; upon one stone are seven facets; behold, I will engrave the graving thereof, saith the Domina of hosts: And I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day. 10 In that day, saith the Domina of hosts, shall ye call every woman her neighbour under the vine and under the fig-tree.
